verses.verse: O Israel <WH3478>, return <WH7725> unto the Lord <WH3068> your God <WH430>; for you have fallen <WH3782> by your iniquity <WH5771>.

Take <WH3947> with you words <WH1697>, and turn <WH7725> to the Lord <WH3068>: say <WH559> unto him <WH5375>, Take away all iniquity <WH5771>, and receive <WH3947> us graciously <WH2896>: so will we render <WH7999> the calves <WH6499> of our lips <WH8193>.

Asshur <WH804> shall not save <WH3467> us <WH7392>; we will not ride upon horses <WH5483>: neither will we say <WH559> any more to the work <WH4639> of our hands <WH3027>, You are our gods <WH430>: for in you the fatherless <WH3490> finds mercy <WH7355>.
I will heal <WH7495> their backsliding <WH4878>, I will love <WH157> them freely <WH5071>: for my anger <WH639> is turned away from him <WH7725>.
I will be as the dew <WH2919> unto Israel <WH3478>: he shall grow <WH6524> as the lily <WH7799>, and cast forth <WH5221> his roots <WH8328> as Lebanon <WH3844>.
His branches <WH3127> shall spread <WH3212>, and his beauty <WH1935> shall be as the olive tree <WH2132>, and his smell <WH7381> as Lebanon <WH3844>.

They that live <WH3427> under his shadow <WH6738> shall return <WH7725>; they shall revive <WH2421> as the corn <WH1715>, and grow <WH6524> as the vine <WH1612>: the scent <WH2143> there shall be as the wine <WH3196> of Lebanon <WH3844>.

Ephraim <WH669> shall say <WH6091>, What have I to do any more with idols? I have heard <WH6030> him <WH7789>, and observed him <WH7488>: I am like a green fir tree <WH1265>. From me is your fruit <WH6529> found <WH4672>.

Who is wise <WH2450>, and he shall understand <WH995> these things <WH995>? prudent, and he shall know <WH3045> them <WH1870>? for the ways of the Lord <WH3068> are right <WH3477>, and the just <WH6662> shall walk <WH3212> in them <WH6586>: but the transgressors shall fall in it <WH3782>.
